item.description:
Hi Everyone,

http://www.meetup.com/HCR-SK/events/46618472/

Saturday: Snow, mainly before 4pm. High near 31. North wind between 5 and 9 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New snow accumulation of 3 to 5 inches possible. 

By 6:30 - 7 pm, the roads should be just fine.. !

This is New England, a little snow is easily removed and common.

I am more worried about "wimps"  than any snow :-)

Weather Update: http://forecast.weather.gov/MapClick.php?CityName=Durham&state=CT&site=OKX&textField1=41.4739&textField2=-72.6819&e=1

Tide Conditions: Use it for your clothes and assume lots of water...

 ITS TIME FOR A: 

POTLUCK DINNER AND A MOVIE with our Kayaking ~ Hiking ~ Camping Friends on a Winter  Saturday Evening.

 Hilarious Comedy about three male friends who go on a canoe trip and the many "discoveries" trials and challenges they encounter.  

Description: To honor a childhood oath, three friends (Seth Green - Matthew Lillard - and Dax Shepard) head into the Oregon wilderness in search of lost treasure. After grappling with a bear, whitewater rapids, backwoods psychopaths, beautiful eco-terrorists, homophobia, and a very hairy Burt Reynolds, the guys  face their fears and learn valuable life lessons about treasuring friendship. 

This movie reminds me of "road hogs" with John Travalta or "City Slickers" with Billy Crystal.

This Event is simply A winter gathering of friends to enjoy a grand potluck dinner and a movie on a 52 inch screen with surround sound for the evening.

 Bring a pillow,  and a *HEALTHY APPETIZER* or *VEGETABLE  DISH* to share, (because its time to get into shape for the aggressive paddling season planned for 2012).

Barbara will provide a couple of main courses beer and lemonade and coffee.

Feel free to bring wine or your favourite beverage(s) of choice.

Location: address will be sent out to Positive RSVP's FRIDAY NIGHT & SATURDAY noon OR SO -- prior to the event.

GPS ADDRESS: x 

General Landmarks: The Madison home is North Madison close to Durham and Route 68 and Route 9 – it’s not as far as you think -- apx 30 minutes from Hartford.

Limited to 20 people.

 

Ok see some of you there.

al-r
item.how_to_find_us: i will stick the 6 foot ORANGE Pole (or STRIPED TRAFFIC CONES) by the walkway when i get there.

group.who: River and Shore Kayak-r's of CT
group.name: ~~~~HARTFORD COUNTY RIVERS & CT SHORE KAYAK GROUP~~~~ HCR-SK

item.name: JAN 21 -GRAND POTLUCK DINNER & MOVIE NIGHT - "Without a Paddle"- ON AS SCHEDULED
